file_content.text: The Organas continue to spew venom about House Ulgo. So much for their virtue of forgiveness.
My scouts tell me you have succeeded, and the Organa frequencies are jammed with angry rhetoric.
Any reasonable voice, including the Jedi, is being drowned out in their hatred of House Ulgo.
It is too much to hope that they will come to blows, but this revulsion will serve us well.
I did what you wanted, but you don't sound pleased.
Satisfied?
This is how I express elation. It is something my colleagues get used to.
That was repulsive.
Be comforted that any violation you feel is felt by the Organas and Jedi ten times over.
That's what I like to hear.
Your pride is deserved.
I will monitor the situation as it degenerates. If the fear and hatred last, we will add this to our roster of tactics.
The longer they forget about House Thul, the more time we have to maneuver. Then the endgame can begin.
Horrify them. Burn the atrocity into their brain so they report every detail.
I am Lord Malichose. I was told you were coming and was given some background information.
Collectively, you are powerful, but I require determination as much as combined firepower.
Your exploits prove you are capable, but I require... more.
The Organas have sent spies and several Padawan Jedi here to scout the Ulgo's fortress. I need the Organas dispatched.
Why do the Ulgos work for them?
Why are we defending Ulgos?
The Ulgos, like the Organas, believe they can fight one another under the pretense of rules, which both nobly adhere to.
So put down some mines and check back in a week.
Is this worth my time?
That would be short-term progress. You must understand--Alderaanians, especially Organas, adhere to a code of conduct in war.
With pleasure.
Quantity of casualties is secondary. You will assault the pride of the Alderaanians. They believe warfare can be conducted civilly.
This is why the Organas must be shocked into hating the Ulgos more than the Empire or House Thul. Disgust is our weapon.
If the Ulgos will not provide a sufficient outrage, a sufficient atrocity, we--that is, you--must do it for them.
I doubt they will cleave to their precious rules once their opponents do not.
I like where this is going.
Exactly. Your assignment is to kill the Padawan Jedi and scouts of the Organas.
Fakery does not hold up well in the long run.
I doubt this will work.
Fakery, no. Visceral reaction is my plan's strength. You must kill Organa scouts and Jedi.
How would I do that?
I need you to kill Organa scouts and whatever Padawan Jedi you can find.
The ultimate goal is for the Organas to exhaust themselves bringing war to the Ulgo's doorstep. Revulsion is the first step in this plan.
If it serves us strategically, I will do this.
I can stomach it.
I'm glad you see the benefit. Now, we have concocted a kit of common implements carried by Ulgo troops.
I will give you atrocities. In abundance.
I was born for this.
Enthusiasm is good, but I do not suggest... improvisation. We have here a kit containing common implements Ulgo soldiers carry.
These items will give the act the... homemade authenticity needed to convince a skeptical observer.
Kill the Jedi. Kill the Organas. Use the tools provided and return here. It is not so difficult if you have the will.
How can you just stand there and ask me to commit war crimes?
This is wrong. [Refuse quest]
Would you rather I pace back and forth?
These mountains crawl with Organas, and worse, Jedi.
In seriousness, however, hesitation is normal. Once you have seen how House Thul needs us, I think you will reconsider.
Then desecrate the remains. The Organas will find them and blame the bodies on the Ulgo.
There were notable successes, but I remain unclear on your tolerance for... psychological assignments.
You have ascended from the low-born based on merit, but I require... commitment.
Your specific deeds are classified to me, so I do not know the... moral nature of your assignments.
You are a professional, but most professionals have limits. What I propose may exceed them.
There is no emotion, there is-- ahh! The Elysium! They're at the Elysium! The old meeting place...ahh!
The Elysium is full of history...it's the old meeting place of the houses. The Padawans are there to study, not to-- ahh!
Those Padawans are protected by some of Organa's strongest troops...and a Jedi Master. You won't get away with this...ahh!
